summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Environmental Commission of Dallas is holding a regular meeting on November 13, 2024, at 5:30 p.m. at Dallas City Hall, with a virtual option via Webex. The purpose of the meeting is to discuss environmental initiatives, review past minutes, and make decisions on upcoming projects and policies.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of minutes from previous meetings (September 11 and October 9, 2024).
2. Briefing on the Comprehensive Environmental & Climate Action Plan (CECAP) Annual Report.
3. Discussion on an amendment to the Off-Street Parking and Loading Code.

**Important Details**:  
- The CECAP Annual Report will be presented by key staff from the Office of Environmental Quality and Sustainability, highlighting progress and future goals.
- The proposed amendment to the Off-Street Parking and Loading Code aims to enhance urban planning and sustainability efforts.

**Action Items**:  
- Approval of the 2025 meeting calendar.
- Updates from various subcommittees focusing on Environmental Health, Justice, Implementation, Outreach, and Strategic Partnerships.
- Registration for public speakers is required at least 24 hours prior to the meeting.

This meeting will also include announcements and updates from commissioners, as well as information on upcoming related meetings. The session will conclude with an opportunity for public input.
